intro: Cirsium jorullense subsp. enjorullense, commonly known as the Enjorullense thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pink flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as scrublands and open woodlands. It has a compact growth form with a short, upright stem. This subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral characteristics, making it a notable species in local flora.
